title: How to Add an App Back to Home Screen: Tips for Finding Apps

steps.title: Look inside app folders on a home screen.
steps.content: Look inside app folders on a home screen. If you have app folders on one of your home screen pages, follow these steps to move an app outside the folder: Tap the app folder. It's a dark gray square containing multiple apps. Tap, hold, and drag the app outside of the border of the folder. Release your finger to place the app on the home screen outside of the app folder.

steps.title: Add the app from your App Library.
steps.content: Add the app from your App Library. If you can't find the app you're looking for on a home screen page or in an app folder, it will be in your App Library. To find the app and add it to your home screen : [1] X Research source Swipe all the way to the right from a home screen page. This will take you to the App Library screen. Tap the App Library search bar at the top of the screen. Search for the app you're looking for. Tap and hold the app to open its context menu. Tap Add to Home Screen . The app will appear in an open space on a home screen page.

steps.title: Uninstall and reinstall the app.
steps.content: Uninstall and reinstall the app. If you can't add the app the home screen, but it does appear in the App Library, try uninstalling and reinstalling the app: Swipe all the way to the right from a home screen page. This will take you to the App Library screen. Tap the App Library search bar at the top of the screen. Search for the app you're looking for. Tap and hold the app to open its context menu. Tap Delete App . [2] X Research source Reinstall the app from the App Store.

steps.title: Find deleted apps.
steps.content: Find deleted apps. If you think the app has been completely uninstalled from the phone, you can find the deleted app and reinstall it: [3] X Research source Open the App Store . It's a blue icon with a white "A" on it. Tap the profile button in the top right of the app. Tap Purchased . Search for the deleted app. Tap the cloud icon next to the deleted app to reinstall it.

steps.title: Unhide a home screen page.
steps.content: Unhide a home screen page. Sometimes an entire home screen page can be hidden, preventing you from accessing the apps on that page. To unhide a page: [4] X Research source Go to any home page screen. Tap and hold an empty space on the screen. This will switch the home pages to edit mode. Tap the circles at the bottom of the home page, above the quick access bar. Tap the circle under the hidden home screen page. It will fill in with a check mark. Tap an empty space in the page edit menu. Tap an empty space on the home page to exit edit mode.

steps.title: Turn off an app's content restriction.
steps.content: Turn off an app's content restriction. If you can't find an app on the home screen or in the App Library, it may be hidden by the content restriction feature. To allow an app: [5] X Research source Open the Settings app from a home screen page. It's a gray gears icon. Tap Screen Time . Select Content & Privacy Restrictions . Enter the Screen Time code. Tap Allowed Apps . Toggle on the app you want to enable.

steps.title: Reset the layout of your home screen to the default format.
steps.content: Reset the layout of your home screen to the default format. This will restore your home screen to the factory default settings, revealing hidden default apps and removing any folders. To reset the home screen: [6] X Research source Open the Settings app from a home screen page. It's a gray gears icon. Tap General . Tap Transfer or Reset . Tap Reset . Tap Reset Home Screen Layout .

steps.title: Look inside app folders on a home screen.
steps.content: Look inside app folders on a home screen. If you have app folders on one of your home screen pages, follow these steps to move an app outside the folder: Tap the app folder. Tap, hold, and drag the app outside of the border of the folder. Release your finger to place the app on the home screen outside of the app folder.

steps.title: Add the app from the app drawer.
steps.content: Add the app from the app drawer. If the app is downloaded on your device but doesn't appear on the home screen, you can add it to a home screen from the app drawer. To do so: [7] X Research source Swipe from the bottom edge of your screen to the top edge. This will open the app drawer. Tap, hold, and drag the app. You'll see each home screen appear. (You can remove blank home screens if needed.) Move the app to a home screen and release your finger.

steps.title: Re-enable apps.
steps.content: Re-enable apps. Some apps can be disabled without being deleted, hiding them from the home screen and app drawer. To re-enable an app: [8] X Research source Open the Google Play Store . It's a triangle made of yellow, red, blue, and green shapes. Tap the profile button. Select Manage apps & device . Tap Manage . Tap the app you want to re-enable. Tap Enable .

steps.title: Unhide hidden apps.
steps.content: Unhide hidden apps. Apps can be hidden from the home screen and app drawer without being deleted. To unhide these apps: [9] X Research source Swipe from the bottom edge of your screen to the top edge. This will open the app drawer. Tap the â‹® button in the top right of the app drawer. Select Hide apps . Unselect apps that you want to unhide.

steps.title: Uninstall and reinstall the app.
steps.content: Uninstall and reinstall the app. If you can't add the app the home screen, but it does appear in the app drawer, try uninstalling and reinstalling the app: Open the Google Play Store. It's a triangle made of yellow, red, blue, and green shapes. Tap the profile button. Select Manage apps & device . Tap Manage . Tap the app you want to uninstall. Tap Uninstall . [10] X Research source Reinstall the app from the Google Play Store.
